caption: b"Congratulations to all of the leaders recognized as this year's @automotivenews' Top 100 Leading Women in the North American Auto Industry, including our own Mary Barra, Pam Fletcher, Stacy Lynett, Susan Sheffield, Christine Stiek and Deborah Wahl. The examples being set by these women today will help the next generation of women to transform the world tomorrow. Learn more at the link in our bio."
b"What's your vehicle style? With our flexible #EV Ultium platform we're re-imagining what it means to go all-electric. Follow the link in our bio to learn more."

b"We've committed to sourcing 100% of our global energy from renewables by 2040 because we know sustainable production is just as important as sustainable products. Learn more about our #RenewableEnergy journey at the link in our bio."

b"If you're a K-6 #STEM #PublicSchoolTeacher, you're invited to join us in #ElectrifyingEngineering for your students while earning funding for your classroom at the same time. Learn more about our collaboration with @DonorsChoose at the link in our bio.\n\nNot a teacher? Help us spread the word by tagging one below!"

b"As an illustration major, Carly Davis wasn't sure what her path would look like after graduation. That changed when she was introduced to industrial design by her 3D design professor. Here's how she's using her illustration skills to visualize future products and help bring them to life."

b"When you're committed to building an electric future, it's more than a job \xe2\x80\x94 it's a lifestyle. This Thursday at 3PM EDT, join @Chevrolet #EV experts for a live Power Panel on Chevy's Youtube channel, where they'll be answering your questions and discussing the future of #EVs."

b"Over the last 2 months, we've announced numerous updates to our #EV programs that span nearly every aspect of the EV ecosystem, from accelerating development and adoption to investments in charging infrastructure. At the link in our bio, President Mark Reuss offers a closer look at why this multi-faceted approach is the key to winning the EV race."

b"We envision a safe, healthy future for everyone, and our team members continue to prove they have what it takes to help us get there. Today, as we wrap up our annual Global Safety Week, we're paying tribute to our employees, contractors and suppliers from around the world who came together to face the unprecedented challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic."
b"We're combining the classic @Cadillac style with our all-new Ultium battery system to electrify American luxury. Learn more about the recently revealed LYRIQ show car at the link in our bio."
b"Sometimes the biggest leaps forward are actually diagonal. Here's a sneak peek at @GMC's upcoming #GMCHummerEV. Tune in to the full vehicle reveal on October 20 to learn more."

b'"I knew right there that\'s what I wanted to do. I want to make people say wow."\xc2\xa0\n\nWhile walking down the streets of Brazil with her father as a kid, Junia Martins Lapp had what she calls a "wow moment" when a red sportscar drove by. Above, she shares the story of how she followed that passion all the way to our Design Center in Warren, Mich.'

b"The world has changed drastically since we announced our flexible platform and Ultium battery system, but we remain steadfast in our commitment to an all-electric future. We're excited to introduce the @cadillac LYRIQ show car, our first (of many) Ultium-powered #EVs to be revealed. Follow the link in our bio to learn more."

b"The @girlscouts' all-new automotive badge series will offer girls nationwide the opportunity to explore #STEM and the automotive industry. Learn more about these badges from the leaders and former #GirlScouts on our team who helped develop them at the link in our bio."

b'Chris Webb joined our creative team working on concept cars in 2000, but his creative journey began when, at eleven years old, he entered a contest to imagine The Duchess of York\xe2\x80\x99s wedding dress. Today, Chris shares the story of how he went from studying fashion to becoming an industrial designer.'
b"This week's #ElectrifyingEngineering video is really going to blow you away. Tune in to learn how to harness the power of wind by building your very own windmill!"

b'Unlike gas-powered cars, we "re-fuel" electric vehicles by plugging them in and charging their batteries. This week on #ElectrifyingEngineering, you and your kids\xc2\xa0will learn how #EV chargers work and where you can spot them.'

b'This week on #ElectrifyingEngineering, Vehicle Chief Engineer Jeremy Short uses radio-controlled cars to explain how gas-powered vehicles doffer from electric vehicles, and how EVs are able to run without creating tailpipe emissions.'

b"Innovation is a team effort. Here's a behind-the-scenes look at the work our engineers are doing to support our vision of an all-electric future. Follow the link in our bio to learn more about our Ultium flat battery technology."
b"Batteries may seem complicated, but you and your kids can easily build one out of everyday household items! Find out how in this week's episode of #ElectrifyingEngineering."

b'In response to COVID-19, our teams mobilized to launch a new ventilator production line in just one month. Follow the link in our bio to listen to a recent episode of Masters Of Scale, where Chairman and CEO Mary Barra shares what we learned and how we\'re working to keep moving "ventilator fast" in the future.'

b'We proudly celebrated the 50th anniversary of Pride Month by raising the Pride flag at our facilities across the globe. Learn more about our continued commitment to the LGBTQ+ community at the link in our bio.'

b"We are excited to announce that our 2021 student recruitment season has officially begun! We're looking for bold, innovative thinkers to join us in working toward our vision of a future with\xc2\xa0zero crashes, zero emissions and zero congestion.\n\nLearn more and explore our internship and entry-level opportunities at the link in our bio."

b"If you could design your dream #EV, what would it look like? Today, our designers will walk you through the process of designing a car of the future. When you're done, share your designs using #ElectrifyingEngineering. We can't wait to see them!"

b'As our Chairman and CEO Mary Barra explains above, inclusivity is not a competition, but something every company needs to continuously work toward. Follow the link in our bio to hear her full interview on #BackToBiz with Katie Couric and Bozoma Saint John.'

b"Last year, we became the first automaker to join the @HumanRightsCampaign Equality Act Business Coalition. As we celebrate #Pride2020 and today's Supreme Court ruling, we remain committed to supporting a future where everyone is ensured equal workplace protections regardless of gender identity or sexual orientation."
b'Have you ever wondered how autonomous vehicles are able to "see" the world around them? Find out in this week\'s #ElectrifyingEngineering video featuring Autonomous Vehicle Engineer Charles Muse.'
b"This week on our #ElectrifyingEngineering series we're sharing an easy way your kids can measure the air particles around you and your home. We can't wait to see your results!"

b'Electric motors are all around us, powering everything from remote control toy cars to full-sized electric vehicles. This week on #ElectrifyingEngineering you and your future engineers will learn how electric motors work and how you can build one together at home.'

b"Starting this weekend, we're inviting you and your entire family to join us for immersive, kid-friendly lessons on sustainability, #EV design and more. Tune in to #ElectrifyingEngineering every Sunday at the link in our bio."

b'Our Chairman and CEO, Mary Barra, shares a few words of wisdom and encouragement for the graduating class of 2020. Tag the 2020 graduates in your life who you know are going to help change the world. #ClassOf2020'

b'As our Chairman and CEO, Mary Barra, has said, the work being done to build life-saving ventilators in our Kokomo, IN, facility is our team at its best, and we are so proud of everyone working to make it happen.\xc2\xa0#WeAreGM'

b'The auto industry was built by people with a desire to overcome challenges. Today, we\xe2\x80\x99re determined to leverage that same spirit of innovation and the ingenuity of our people to help our country, and the world, overcome this global pandemic.\xc2\xa0Click the link in our bio to learn how we\xe2\x80\x99re leveraging our scale and expertise to help Ventec Life Systems produce more @myvocsn critical care ventilators for those in need.'

b'We challenged our team to design a platform that could support future electric vehicles of all styles, price points and performance levels. The result was a highly flexible platform powered by our new Ultium batteries. Follow the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'We believe strongly in\xc2\xa0gender equity, and we are dedicated to having a diverse and welcoming workplace that values the contributions of all employees. This year and every year, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to creating a culture where every employee can thrive.\xc2\xa0#IWD2020'

b'This week, we unveiled our #ElectricVehicle strategy from our historic Design Dome in Warren, MI. We\xe2\x80\x99re creating EVs for every brand, segment, price point and style, with technology that has the power to redefine\xc2\xa0mobility for generations to come.\n\nAnd this is only the beginning.'

b"Our electric future is now:high_voltage:

Our all-new modular platform and Ultium batteries will be the heartbeat of our all-electric future \xe2\x80\x93 powering electric vehicles in every segment to meet the needs of every person. One architecture can underpin vehicles from @Cadillac cars to @Chevrolet SUVs to @GMC HUMMER EVs.

Combined with the power of GM's Ultium batteries, select vehicles could:

Enable a GM-estimated range up to 400 miles on a full charge with 0-60 in as low as 3 seconds.

Have energy ranges from 50 to more than 200 kilowatt-hours

Support front-wheel drive, rear-wheel drive, or all-wheel drive applications

And that's not all. Click the link in our bio to learn more. #ZeroEmissions"

b'Our Design Dome was the epicenter of exciting news today as we revealed our all-new modular platform and Ultium batteries. Click the link in our bio to learn how they will help us scale our electric vehicle portfolio at a rapid pace. #ZeroEmissions'

b'The desire to connect people and take them places they want to go remains at the core of our vision for a world with zero crashes, zero emissions and zero congestion. Click the link in our bio to see the future we envision.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cOur end goal is to help create an effortless charging experience for our customers\xe2\x80\x9d -Dalya Aboona, EV charging and infrastructure engineer. Click the link in our bio to learn more about how Dalya and team are making the home, workplace, and public charging experience better. #EngineersWeek #EWeek2020'
b'Congratulations to Marcos Purty and Eric Fonville for receiving awards from the Black Engineer of the Year Awards. Click the link in our bio to get inspired by their careers. #WeAreGM #EWeek2020'

b'Andy Oury, one of our battery engineers, talks about how our next-generation #EV batteries will feature a flexible, modular design that can be applied across our brands and vehicle platforms. Click the link in our bio to read more. #EngineersWeek #EWeek2020 #BatteryDay'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cOne of the things that draws you to engineering is a desire to learn and to be fascinated by the new\xe2\x80\x9d - Jesse Ortega, chief engineer. Click the link in our bio to learn more about how our vision inspires Jesse to turn #EV creative concepts into reality. #EngineersWeek #EWeek2020'
b'100% commitment to sustainability. See how we\xe2\x80\x99re accelerating our path to create a better planet we can all be proud of. Click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re kicking off 2020 by\xc2\xa0announcing\xc2\xa0one of our most anticipated vehicles, the\xc2\xa0#GMCHummerEV\xc2\xa0super truck. A true mark of progress toward a world with #ZeroEmissions. Click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'Electric trucks, SUVs and the @cruise Origin \xe2\x80\x93 all built here in our hometown. This is what the future of transportation looks like. Tap the link in our bio to learn more. #Detroit #ZeroEmissions'
b"Our CMO, Deborah Wahl, is joining the world's biggest innovators at #CES2020 to talk about how we're transforming the future of mobility through technology and innovation."

b'Meet Jigar Kapadia, our lead sound design engineering specialist. Leading the development of our recently opened sound recording studio, Jigar focuses on how the customer will react as he creates sounds for our vehicles. Click the link in our bio for his full story.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe future of mobility is still very much an emerging space. GM\xe2\x80\x99s core business is building and selling cars, trucks and crossovers, and we have a lot of best practices doing that. But with Maven, GM\xe2\x80\x99s car-sharing business, nothing has been done before, so we have to test, learn and pivot all the time\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 VP of Urban Mobility and Maven Sigal Cordeiro shared this week at @fortunemag\xe2\x80\x99s Most Powerful Women Next Gen Summit.'
b'Good things come in threes.\nSwipe to see!'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re teaming up with LG Chem to mass-produce battery cells for future EVs. The collaboration will help drive down battery costs while improving the technology for our customers. Click the link in our bio to learn more. #zeroemissions'

b"Meet Bianca, a creative designer on our team who brings our logos and event exhibits to life. Her passion for design started at a young age, and when it came time to choose a career, joining a team where she could express her creativity was a top priority. Tap the link in our bio to see Bianca's story."

b'We believe in an all-electric future. With the advancements in EV, there is no doubt we are on the cusp of an auto revolution. Click the link in our bio for more from our President, Mark Reuss, as he breaks down the barriers to making electric cars mainstream. #ZeroEmissions'
b'We recently attended the @forbesunder30 Summit to speak to some of the brightest scholars about where our future is headed and how we will get there. #WeAreGM'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re committed to developing a workforce equipped to discover solutions for challenges we have yet to face. Cheryl Greer, an engineer by day and a teacher by night, is just one example of how we help students discover their passion. Click the link in our bio for Cheryl\xe2\x80\x99s full story. #NationalSTEMDay'

b'The third quarter of 2019 reflects the continued momentum of our full-size pickup truck franchise, following the successful launch of both light-duty and heavy-duty models. Despite a two-week U.S. work stoppage during the quarter, these results demonstrate the resilience of our company.\n\nSee our full Q3 earnings report in the link in our bio.'
b'What\xe2\x80\x99s life like on the @forbesunder30 list? We asked our very own Kayla and Keysha to tell us what making the list has meant for their careers. #WeAreGM'

b'Investing in your personal branding can boost your confidence and give you a head start in your career journey. Swipe to see our top 5 tips! Hear more from our very own Global Talent Development Manager, Kristi Stepp, at this year\xe2\x80\x99s @forbesunder30 Summit.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cAlexa, add iced coffee to my grocery list.\xe2\x80\x9d We\xe2\x80\x99re excited to be bringing an embedded @amazon Alexa voice experience along for the ride. Using Alexa, customers will be able to receive their personalized news flash, update grocery lists, get navigation and more. Tap the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'Imagine knowing that you have the freedom to go wherever you want, regardless of age or physical capabilities. Our self-driving vehicles have the potential to improve mobility for those who currently cannot drive. Learn more in the link in our bio. #ZeroCrashes'

b"Building the mid-engine Chevrolet @Corvette took years of #engineering and a mighty #design team led by Kirk Bennion. Much of the inspiration behind the all-new Stingray came from today's pop culture and military aircraft."

b'Gender equality is more than a hashtag. It is the work we do every day to create gender parity across our entire company \xe2\x80\x94 on the manufacturing floor and in the boardroom. It\xe2\x80\x99s having two women lead as CEO and CFO, being ranked #1 for advancing women in the workplace, and having no gender pay gap. That\xe2\x80\x99s equality in action, and we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to continued progress. #WomensEqualityDay'

b"Meet Tristan Murphy, a lead interior design manager whose team helped develop the innovative craftsmanship of the all-new 2020 #Chevrolet @Corvette Stingray. By combining bold design choices with iconic tradition, Tristan's team was able to create a unique, driver-focused experience."

b'We believe #autonomous vehicles can provide safer, more accessible and sustainable means of transportation for everyone. This technology will play a pivotal role in our journey toward a world with #ZeroCrashes, #ZeroEmissions and #ZeroCongestion.'

b'Meet Guy Samuels, an exterior designer who combined form and function to help bring the 2020 #Chevrolet @Corvette Stingray to life. Building a mid-engine Corvette required Guy\xe2\x80\x99s expertise in integrating aesthetics with engine components.'

b'DYK: Our #AVs drove 3.5 times more miles in 2018 than in 2017. That underscores the tremendous progress we\xe2\x80\x99re making toward the commercial introduction of AVs\xe2\x80\x89\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x89a key part of our #ZeroCrashes vision.'

b'DYK: To support our growing #EV portfolio, we invested $28 million in our battery lab at our Global Technical Center, where we conduct nearly all battery testing to reduce development time and cost.'

b'The second quarter of 2019 reflects the strong performance of our full-size light-duty pickup truck rollout and our transformational cost-savings initiatives. We see an additional upside as we complete the launch of our heavy-duty trucks in the second half of the year.\n\nSee our full Q2 earnings report in the link in our bio.'

b'During this year\xe2\x80\x99s @naacp 110th Convention, Iman, Kai and Jacqueline joined a panel to discuss the economic opportunities available to young entrepreneurs through @drivemaven, venture funding for #tech startups and owning your own dealership. Read more at the link in our bio. #NAACP110'

b'We stopped by the 2019 annual GM-UAW Car Show where hundreds of people came to share their love for classic cars. It was a great day filled with stories, excitement and a whole lot of pride. #WeAreGM'

b'Our efforts toward charitable donations, human rights initiatives, community engagement, work-life balance satisfaction, emissions savings and pay equity got us ranked #1 in the automotive industry by @justcapital_ for supporting healthy communities and families. #WeAreGM'

b'The 2020 Chevrolet @Corvette Stingray is a marvel of modern engineering. Click the link in our bio to learn from John Wilkinson, a lead performance engineer, about how the #technology used to develop the all-new Corvette fits into our all-electric future.'
b'DYK: In 2018, 20 percent of our global electricity needs were met by renewable energy. We are well on the way to our commitment of 100 percent by 2050.'
b'Home of the free, because of the brave. Wishing everyone a safe and Happy #IndependenceDay!'
b'Sometimes you find your passion. Sometimes it finds you. Put your passions to work and explore what a #career with us could look like today. #WeAreGM'

b'We see a world with #ZeroCrashes, #ZeroEmissions and #ZeroCongestion \xe2\x80\x94 which means accelerating progress toward an era of safer, better and more personal mobility. We\xe2\x80\x99re integrating sustainability into every part of our business. Click the link in our bio to see our full 2018 Sustainability Report.'

b"We're proud to invest in the talent, the solutions and the work of the future. By partnering with organizations like @solvemit that encourage innovation, we can move faster and more efficiently toward our goal of creating a safer, better, more sustainable world. Read more about our partnership in the link in our bio."

b'Find out why our engineers hid the MultiPro tailgate \xe2\x80\x94\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0now found on the 2019 @GMC Sierra SLT and Denali pickups \xe2\x80\x94 in a secret room for two years at our Vehicle Engineering Center in Warren, Michigan. Click the link in our bio to read more.'

b'Amberlee Haselhuhn is a senior researcher of ours and was recently awarded the Michigan Tech\xe2\x80\x99s 2019 Outstanding Young Alumni Award. As a senior researcher, Amberlee is leading projects to develop technical solutions for dissimilar metal joining. She believes the best way to lead her team is by encouraging them to \xe2\x80\x9clive life at the edge of their comfort zone \xe2\x80\x93 learning and personal growth happen when you push yourself.\xe2\x80\x9d'

b'We recently partnered with @ashokachangemakers \xe2\x80\x94 a global organization committed to investing in social entrepreneurs with ideas for a better future \xe2\x80\x94 to recognize and support extraordinary young people who have started projects to improve their schools, neighborhoods and communities through STEM. Click the link in our bio to read more.'
b'We are strengthened by diversity and committed to building a culture where everyone feels respected, valued and welcomed to be their true selves. #Pride2019'

b'For father-son duo Tom and Brian Wallace, @Corvette means more than performance driving and #engineering: it is family. Brian, a Corvette performance engineer, found his home on the team by following the footsteps of his father and best friend. #HappyFathersDay #WeAreGM'

b"Just one pint of donated blood can help save as many as three people's lives. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99re helping @OnStar and @AmericanRedCross fill in the #MissingTypes by inspiring our employees to donate blood through facilitated blood drives. You too can find a location to donate by clicking the link in our bio."

b'@Cadillac\xe2\x80\x99s hands-free driver assistance feature, Super Cruise, will soon take drivers further than ever before, with a total of 200,000 miles of compatible highways available by the end of 2019. Click the link in our bio to learn more.'
b"As a longtime supporter of @motorcitypride, we recently celebrated this year's festival alongside our employees, our brands, and the city of Detroit. #WeAreGM #Pride2019"

b'DYK: Each year, 20% of customers suffer an air loss causing accident, resulting in large amounts of tire disposal and congestion on the roads. Click the link in our bio to learn about the Uptis Prototype and how it can help in reducing congestion and emissions.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re committed to creating a company culture where all employees feel safe, respected and supported. From being the first automaker to offer gender-neutral paid parental leave, to the first and only automaker to join the @humanrightscampaign Business Coalition for the Equality Act, we\xe2\x80\x99re dedicated to building a workforce that\xe2\x80\x99s inclusive and diverse. #Pride2019'

b"We're collaborating with @BechtelCorp \xe2\x80\x93 America's largest construction company \xe2\x80\x93 to help grow our #EV fast-charging stations across the country. Click the link in our bio to read why we believe building a charging network will help us move closer to #ZeroEmissions."

b'Together with @Michelin, we are developing a new airless wheel technology, the Uptis Prototype. This will help to further reduce the use of raw materials and waste, furthering our vision for a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. Click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'Tadge\xe2\x80\x99s early fascination with mechanics began with building bikes as a kid and quickly evolved into a passion for state of the art functionality. Today, he serves as executive chief engineer, leading the global team of innovators responsible for developing the features and #technology found in future @Corvette models.'

b'To celebrate some of our rising stars, we invited 25 employees to the @detroitgp, where they rode passenger during hot laps around Belle Isle with some of our executives \xe2\x80\x94 it was a track of high performance all around. #WeAreGM'

b'Meet Jomayra Sanchez, a design release engineer for performance brake cooling. She\xe2\x80\x99s taking over our Instagram Story today for a behind the scenes look at our employee hot lap event happening at the @detroitgp! Head to our profile to check it out. :racing_car::dashing_away:'
b'ICYMI: We recently launched our all-new digital vehicle platform that will debut in the 2020 @cadillac CT5. Click the link in our bio to read more.'

b'Meet Rachel Kuhn, our director of innovation and a recent Brand Star Detroit honoree. She leads and inspires a team of problem-solvers by creating a safe work culture and encouraging them to learn fast and fail quickly to discover the best solutions.'
b"Today, we are honoring the memory of our nation's soldiers as we reflect on the sacrifices they made to protect and serve our nation. #MemorialDay"

b'By partnering with @SolveMIT, we untapped an ecosystem of global entrepreneurs who share a vision in making our planet a better place. See how one inventor is using #technology to improve communication for those with disabilities.'

b'Five times more processing power, smartphone-like software updates and enhanced cybersecurity \xe2\x80\x93 all features of our all-new digital vehicle platform that will enable the vehicle technology of the future. Click the link in our bio to read more.'

b'As managers of #EV charging and infrastructure, Kelly Helfrich and Jordan Catrine are determined to\xc2\xa0 make our goal of an all-electric future a reality \xe2\x80\x94 by creating the best customer charging experience for EV drivers, including decreasing range anxiety.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re committed to #safety and our engineers work hard to design systems that help drivers stay safe on the road. Today, @Chevrolet introduced an industry-first Buckle to Drive feature that reminds young drivers to buckle up before driving.'

b'As we work toward our vision to create a world with\xc2\xa0#ZeroEmissions, we\xe2\x80\x99re bringing our suppliers along with us to help create a more\xc2\xa0sustainable natural rubber industry. Two years ago, we announced a focus on sourcing sustainable natural rubber for tires and we continue to make progress. Click the link in our bio to read the full story.'

b'Car enthusiast, aeronautical and astronautical engineering major and our lead aerodynamicist, Charles Muse, ensures that our crossover vehicles are designed for the best energy performance. Head over to our IGTV for his full video.'
